result.execSummary:
The defendant CHRISTOPHER J. KEUSCHEL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All financials same as noted above.

Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission already on file.

09:15 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER J. KEUSCHEL in court with attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge.  Defendant CHRISTOPHER J. KEUSCHEL in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters N.C. plea to counts 1 and 2.   Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty. State and Defense make sentencing recommendation. Court orders $500 fine and costs, DNA sample and surcharge and Count 2 $50 fine and costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:54 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER J. KEUSCHEL in court with attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge.  Defendant CHRISTOPHER J. KEUSCHEL in custody.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Stockbridge asks for a Plea and Sentencing date  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription, no contact with known drug users or dealers, no travel outside the State without prior court approval, no entry into any Class B licensed establishments, defendant must comply with all policies and procedures of Treatment Facility, picture & prints

Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription.  No contact with known drug users or dealers.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.  No entry into any Class B licensed establishments.  Picture and prints. Defendant must comply with all policies and procedures of Treatment Facility.

08:39 AM Attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge in court.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Stockbridge updates Court their is a bed date now available and bond should be converted to signature bond. State does not object. Court will order conversion of bond and adds conditions of bond Defendant must comply with treatment facility rules and policies.
